# The Command Dial

The front command dial is used for the operations below.

!Command Dial

## Shooting

- Choose the desired combination of shutter speed and aperture (program shift).
- Choose a shutter speed.
- Adjust aperture.
- Adjust exposure compensation.
- Adjust sensitivity.

> ðŸ’¡ **Note:**
> - During shooting, the role of the front command dial changes each time the center of the dial is pressed.
> - For information on the roles performed by the dials during shooting, see â€œFront Command Dial Roles by Modeâ€ (page 67).

## Menus

Rotate the dial to select menu tabs or page through menus.

## Q Menu

Rotate the dial to change settings in the quick menu and press the center of the dial to select.

## Playback

- View other pictures.
- Zoom in or out during full- or multi-frame playback.

> ðŸ’¡ **Note:**
> - Press the center of the front command dial to switch between the two roles.
